channel.description: Recent content in Project Management on Rob's Notes

item.title: Delivering a project and presenting to a multi-level audience
item.description: A project delivery is a culmination of the team’s effort after a series of sprints.

item.title: Handing off a project to a client; what are the risks and challenges?
item.description: The biggest risk and challenge when handing off a project to a client is the fear of meeting the expectation of the client.

item.title: What five technical skills are employers seeking? What five soft skills put you on top?
item.description: layout: post title: “What five technical skills are employers seeking?

item.title: Social Media and Branding
item.description: We are in an era where social media influences everyone more than parents, friends, peers, etc.

item.title: LinkedIn profiles, how to use them, how to market yourself, how to network
item.description: In this post, we take a segway from discussions around Agile methodology and focus on something that is very important for everyone’s career – to have an online professional profile, something that someone can look at and find out about your career, capabilities and achievements.

item.title: Agile tasks lists, what does “done” mean in Agile?
item.description: This is the fourth post in this series of “Introduction to Agile methodology”.

item.title: The Agile Sprint Retrospective
item.description: Agile Sprint Retrospective This is the third post in this series of “Introduction to Agile methodology”.

item.title: The Agile Team and the backlog
item.description: This blog continues on the last week’s blog about introducing Agile to newcomers to the practice.

item.title: What is agile and what are user stories
item.description: Introduction In the earlier days of the software industry, the process of developing software products mirrored engineering practices of the day.
